content.question: For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. The following equation represents the decomposition of <math alttext="N 2 O 5" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>N</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>5</mn></msub></math>, for which the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of N 2 O 5" overflow="scroll"><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mtext>N</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>5</mn></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>. <math alttext="2 N 2 O 5, gas, reacts to produce 4 N O 2, gas, plus O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"> </mspace> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>N</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> <mn>4</mn> <msub> <mrow> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"> </mspace> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> A sample of pure <math alttext="N 2 O 5, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in an evacuated container and allowed to decompose at a constant temperature of <math alttext="300 kelvin" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>300</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"> </mspace> <mtext>K</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. The concentration of <math alttext="N 2 O 5, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>N</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> in the container is measured over a period of time, and the measurements are recorded in the following table. Time (hr) <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 5, in moles per liter" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mo>[</mo> <msub> <mtext>N</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mn>5</mn> </msub> <mo>]</mo> <mo> </mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>M</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo> </mo> </mrow> </math> <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.160" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.160</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.67" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.67</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.0800" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0800</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3.33" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.33</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.0400" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0400</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="5.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.0200" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (a) Determine the value of the rate constant, <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for the reaction. Include units in your answer.

frqParts.text: For parts of the free response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. The following equation represents the decomposition of <math alttext="N 2 O 5" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>N</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>5</mn></msub></math>, for which the rate law is <math alttext="rate equals k times the molar concentration of N 2 O 5" overflow="scroll"><mtext>rate</mtext><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><msub><mtext>N</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mtext>O</mtext><mn>5</mn></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>. <math alttext="2 N 2 O 5, gas, reacts to produce 4 N O 2, gas, plus O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"> </mspace> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>N</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mtext> </mtext> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> <mn>4</mn> <msub> <mrow> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"> </mspace> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> A sample of pure <math alttext="N 2 O 5, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in an evacuated container and allowed to decompose at a constant temperature of <math alttext="300 kelvin" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>300</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"> </mspace> <mtext>K</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. The concentration of <math alttext="N 2 O 5, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>N</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> in the container is measured over a period of time, and the measurements are recorded in the following table. Time (hr) <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 5, in moles per liter" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mo>[</mo> <msub> <mtext>N</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mn>5</mn> </msub> <mo>]</mo> <mo> </mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>M</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo> </mo> </mrow> </math> <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.160" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.160</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.67" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.67</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.0800" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0800</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3.33" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.33</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.0400" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0400</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="5.00" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.0200" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (a) Determine the value of the rate constant, <math alttext="k" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for the reaction. Include units in your answer.

(b) The following mechanism is proposed for the decomposition of <math alttext="N 2 O 5, gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Step 1: <math alttext="N 2 O 5, gas, reacts to produce N O 2, gas, plus N O 3, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>N</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> Step 2: <math alttext="N O 2, gas, plus N O 3, gas, react to produce N O 2, gas, plus N O, gas, plus O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mtext>NO</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mtext>NO</mtext> <mn>3</mn> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>→</mo> <msub> <mtext>NO</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>NO</mtext> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </math> Step 3: <math alttext="N 2 O 5, gas, plus N O, gas, react to produce 3 N O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>N</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mtext>NO</mtext> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mo>→</mo> </mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.4em"> </mspace> <mtext>NO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> Identify which step of the proposed mechanism (<math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, or <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>) is the rate-determining step. Justify your answer in terms of the rate law given.

(c) If this experiment was repeated at the same temperature but with twice the initial concentration of <math alttext="N 2 O 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, would the value of <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increase, decrease, or remain the same? Explain your reasoning.

skill.text: 5.C: Explain the relationship between variables within an equation when one variable changes.
